"INTRODUCTION\
\
Weaponsmiths stand tall among the professions of Castle Marrach. No other craftsperson possesses the unique combination of strength and skill required to forge an effective instrument of war. Applying the hammer to any of twelve basic metals, a seasoned Weaponsmith is capable of executing nearly fifty different designs.\
\
After a weapon is forged, the blade may be optionally engraved with a suitable symbol by an Engraver, or ornamented with a gemstone by a Jeweler. Weaponsmiths are encouraged to acquire skill in either or both of these crafts."

"METALS\
\
Weaponsmiths ply their art upon metal, skillfully working it into blades of varying complexity and appeal. Novices can work common metals such as tin or lead, while more experienced smiths gain access to highly desireable choices, including bronze and steel. Even blades of unalloyed silver and gold are not beyond the ability of a Master weaponsmith."

"DESIGNS\
\
It is not uncommon for residents of the Castle to request weapons designed to reflect their particular personality. Dozens of unique design variations are available to the ambitious weaponsmith, from the \\"common\\" or \\"uninspired\\" attempts of the Novice to the \\"superb\\" artistic achievements of the Master."

"PROFICIENCY\
\
Ten levels of proficiency are recognized for the weaponsmithing skill:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
The following chapters describe the Metal and Design options available to Weaponsmiths at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced weaponsmiths. Their forging skills are admittedly rather limited and pedestrian.\
\
They work in the unpopular materials of none, tin, and lead.\
\
Their designs are none, common, amateurish, nondescript, or uninspired."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Junior Apprentices know a bit more than Novices, but their additional skills can hardly be called impressive.\
\
They begin working in the still useless material of copper.\
\
Their designs, however, are simple, basic, ordinary, serviceable, or rustic."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to be forge useful blades.\
\
They have finally mastered the use of iron for their blades.\
\
Their work is primitive, contemporary, strange, odd, or quaint."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft weaponsmiths have spent many hours learning their trade, and may apply a personal mark to the blades which they forge.\
\
They might, if they wish, forge blades of pewter.\
\
Blades of their design are exotic, unusual, curious, advanced, or whimsical."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen possess the confidence to forge weapons of particular grace and appeal.\
\
They can employ brass or nickel, if they so choose.\
\
Their blades are either fashionable, elaborate, bold, daring, or extravagant."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans have proven themselves capable of the fine control needed to handle some of the more challenging materials and designs.\
\
They can work in bronze and, finally, steel.\
\
They produce weapons which are impressive, fine, formal, striking, or ceremonial."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring uncommon designs and costly metals for their personal armaments. They often serve as assistants to Master Jewelers.\
\
Metal (1 choice): silver\
\
Design (5 choices): antique noble eerie rare subtle"

"MASTER\
\
Masters are the virtuosi of the weaponsmith's art. Their long career of study and craftsmanship has given them the ability to forge creations of the most rarified quality. They can also alter the Metal and Design of weapons that have already been altered.\
\
They can create blades of gold.\
\
Their designs are sometimes disturbing, being either eldritch, blasphemous, archaic, superb, or diabolical."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts are often the most advanced weaponsmiths within the castle; their craft is usually dedicated to satisfying noble and royal requests.\
\
They can somehow work the heavy metal, platinum.\
\
Their craft produces weapons which are ancient, righteous, fell, majestic, or angelic."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
Many seasons may pass between the appearance or creation of a Grand Master weaponsmith within the castle. Their near-miraculous work is almost reserved for royalty.\
\
They may choose to work the amazing material, skymetal.\
\
Their blades are either royal, imperial, or transcendent."

"UPDATES\
\
As fashions change, and the lore of the craft increases, new forging techniques arise, allowing weaponsmiths even more choices. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. Advanced smiths will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of the staff."
